text: wow.
author: TheHyperFix

text: and endorses Michael Steele!!!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Blackwell withdraws....
author: TheHyperFix

text: "We must unleash a new, a new birth of freedom." -- Blackwell.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "We are back on the path to becoming the majority party again." -- Blackwell. Hmmmm.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Blackwell to the podium...loud applause...why didn't more people vote for him.
author: TheHyperFix

text: waiting on blackwell...he is "on his way"
author: TheHyperFix

text: Blackwell to make an announcement...if he is out, Dawson could get very close to the 85 he needs to win.
author: TheHyperFix

text: 5th ballot starts.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Sentiment seems as though this is Dawson's to lose...but what does sentiment know?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Apologies...Steele up NINE votes from 3rd ballot. Total gain since 1st ballot: 14 (Thanks to math whiz Todd Harris.)
author: TheHyperFix

text: Basic arguments -- Dawson: I am one of you, strong conservative; Steele: we need real change, need to send party/country a message.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Another 15 minute break...re-convene at 3 pm...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Total gains/losses since 1st ballot: Dawson (+34), Steele (+21), Anuzis (+9), Blackwell (-5).
author: TheHyperFix

text: Change between 3rd and 4th ballot: Dawson (+28), Steele (+16), Anuzis (+7) and Blackwell (no change).
author: TheHyperFix

text: Anuzis and his 31 votes are the key now.  More likely to go to Steele than Dawson...but where do Blackwell's votes shake out.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Quickie analysis...two person race now...most of Duncan support went to Dawson but still 23 away from magic #.
author: TheHyperFix

text: 4th ballot: Dawson 62, Steele 60, Anuzis 31, Blackwell 15
author: TheHyperFix

text: The gavel...here we go!
author: TheHyperFix

text: COUNT THE VOTES! COUNT THE VOTES! The audience? No, just me.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @jmckeever "this is better than a soap opera" Comments like that one make you a political nerd just like me.  Couldn't agree more.
author: TheHyperFix

text: The RNC is apparently counting votes on an abacus...
author: TheHyperFix

text: One thing for sure: there will be a new RNC chair...even if House and Senate leaders for GOP are the same pre and post 2008.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Saul Anuzis is huddled...how long can/does he stay in?
author: TheHyperFix

text: 4th ballot now over.  Counting begins.
author: TheHyperFix

text: I know Diet Coke w/ Lime is all chemicals...but it tastes SO good.
author: TheHyperFix

text: 4th ballot begins...where do Duncan's votes go?
author: TheHyperFix

text: A five minute recess is voted down!  Awesome...have to love these intraparty squabbles...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Duncan does not endorse....
author: TheHyperFix

text: Remember that Duncan is "of the committee"..Steele is not a member, Dawson is.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "This is an organization that is in good shape" -- Duncan.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Does he does he endorse?  Could tip the result heavily if he decides to weigh in for Dawson or Steele.
author: TheHyperFix

text: HUGE...Duncan now formally out...gets standing O for job he calls "highlight" of my life.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Mike Duncan...."winds of change are blowing at the RNC". Duncan WITHDRAWS.
author: TheHyperFix

text: 4th ballot begins...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Someone yells ''Can we have the vote please?"....here here!
author: TheHyperFix

text: and still we wait...on the plus side...I found gift shop and bought Fig Newtons.
author: TheHyperFix

text: This delay between votes is looooong...maybe deals are being built? Most likely 4th ballot alliance: Steele-Anuzis.
author: TheHyperFix

text: C-SPAN has gone to Gibbs White House presser...a reminder to GOPers in room where they stand.
author: TheHyperFix

text: 4th ballot What to Watch For: Does Anuzis cut a deal with Steele?  How many of Duncan's supporters go to Dawson?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Since 1st ballot, Dawson has gained 6, Steele 5, Anuzis 2; Duncan has lost 8 and Blackwell has lost 5.
author: TheHyperFix

text: The 15-minute break will feature Steele and Dawson trying to feast on Duncan supporters.
author: TheHyperFix

text: If Duncan is done (he is, we think) then will his voters head to Dawson? Seems more likely than to Steele.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Difference between 2nd and 3rd ballots: Steele (+3), Duncan (-4), Dawson (+5), Anuzis (no change), Blackwell (-4)
author: TheHyperFix

text: Steele now favorite...Duncan fade continues...hard for him to stay around...can Dawson emerge as Steele alternative?
author: TheHyperFix

text: 3rd ballot: Steele 51, Duncan 44, Dawson 34, Anuzis 24, Blackwell 15.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Here we go....
author: TheHyperFix

text: @MichaelSzeto "most likely. Journo pen is bursting at the seams"
author: TheHyperFix

text: Tons of reporters here...more journos than RNC members?
author: TheHyperFix

text: @mjerzyk "thinking that Steele is going to take it." General sense in room too.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Just to set the scene -- 2nd ballot results: Duncan 48, Steele 48, Dawson 29, Anuzis 24, Blackwell 19.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Third ballot now done....tallying under way...this will be the BIG one.
author: TheHyperFix

text: We are at Oklahoma in the 3rd ballot roll call...getting there.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Reporters are starting to hunker down for the afternoon..food is being bought...sleeping bags are next.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Jill Lawrence (of USA Today) saves the Fix day: provides uneaten Energy Mix. YES!
author: TheHyperFix

text: The RNC rules dictate that no one has to drop out ever...it's why there can be SO many ballots.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Third ballot begins...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Saul Anuzis wins for best handout...a "box score" that allows you to keep track of the votes for each candidate on each ballot
author: TheHyperFix

text: @anamariecox "Actually, all it means is that a net 5 #rncchair voters changed. All 168 could have but 163 cancelled each other out" YES!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Everyone is comparing their candidate to Jim Nicholson in 1997...we shall see.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @rkudeshi "correct me if I'm wrong, but doesn't that mean only 5 people changed their votes" Yes. Almost total status quo except for Duncan
author: TheHyperFix

text: after each vote, rnc is taking a 15 minute break.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Again, Steele people have to be happy...gaining votes...and now in a tie with Duncan for first.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Generally status quo on second ballot...third ballot is likely where movement happens....
author: TheHyperFix

text: Bad news for Duncan...four less than on last ballot...can he survive past a 3rd ballot?
author: TheHyperFix

text: 2nd ballot: Duncan 48, Steele 48, Dawson 29, Anuzis 24, Blackwell 19
author: TheHyperFix

text: The gavel...here we go...2nd ballot.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @anamariecox "I feel like the tension in the #rncchair room is more the consistency of Jell-O. Something they serve to old people." JELLO!
author: TheHyperFix

text: The vote counting continues...this is like Florida in 2000.
author: TheHyperFix

text: there is a demand from the peanut gallery for wardrobe commentary: Steele -- blue jacket, light blue shirtm blue and yellow striped tie.
author: TheHyperFix

text: You can cut the tension in the room with a knife. Or maybe a spoon. Perhaps the late great spork?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Ok...to reiterate..first ballot: Duncan 52, Steele 46, Dawson 28, Anuzis 22, Blackwell 20. Second ballot being counted.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Some context: Whoever wins this race has HUGE problems to solve.  First on list: countering Obams's 13 million person email list.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Anuzis...still smiling...but unless he moves up on this ballot, it may be all over for him.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Lots of folks wearing blue/white "Steele" name tags...them and the men in red hats are the highlight thus far.
author: TheHyperFix

text: To set the scene...a speaker calls each state (and territory)...they make their way up to front of room to cast votes...not a short process
author: TheHyperFix

text: Ben Ginsberg -- republican uber laywer -- is in the house.
author: TheHyperFix

text: This is a 20-stage process for each vote...man!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Two biggest questions: 1) What is Duncan's ceiling? 2) Is Dawson a legit contender or an also-ran?
author: TheHyperFix

text: The second ballot begins...this is the one that will really tell us where the momentum is in the race.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Rumor is...Duncan trying to cut deal with Blackwell for his votes...even with Blackwell's 20...Duncan still short of 85 he needs.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Kato Dawson faction insist all is well...ready to move on 2nd ballot.
author: TheHyperFix

text: A clarification: NO ONE needs to drop from the ballot...they can all stay in as long as they like.
author: TheHyperFix

text: A reminder of where things stand: As RNC chair race continues, President Obama is speaking on C-SPAN.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Steele people thrilled...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Other thoughts: Anuzis being so close to Blackwell in votes is bad for Saul...Katon needs to move quickly up on 2nd ballot to stay viable.
author: TheHyperFix

text: The next 15 mins...WILD lobbying campaign....Steele sitting pretty at the moment...do Anuzis/Dawson stay in...Blackwell says he will.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Big surprise: Steele SO close to Duncan...can Duncan hold on? 15 minute break before next vote.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Results: Duncan 52, Steele, 46, Dawson 28, Anuzis 22, Blackwell 20
author: TheHyperFix

text: The gavel is being banged...here come the results.
author: TheHyperFix

text: if you need other perspectives @anamariacox also twittering event...from three rows in front of Fix.
author: TheHyperFix

text: the lights are dimming...is the movie about to start?
author: TheHyperFix

text: and still tabulating first ballot...this could take all day.
author: TheHyperFix

text: the others...Mike Steele (Md.), Mike Duncan (Ky.), Katon Dawson (S.C.) and Ken Blackwell (Ohio)
author: TheHyperFix

text: @sallynorris "Remind us who Saul Anuzis is". Sorry, Michigan GOP chair and one of five candidates for RNC Chair.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Michael Steele is working the room...laughing and "looking" relaxed.
author: TheHyperFix

text: first ballot is now being tabulated.  Floor is "at ease"...let the glad-handing begin.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Shannon Flaherty (Blackwell's flack) drops off a reminder...that Jim Nicholson won in 1997 fter getting just 23 votes on 1st ballot.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Lots of men in red hats with nothing written on them...ushers? enforcers?
author: TheHyperFix

text: saul anuzis pacing room nervously....
author: TheHyperFix

text: First ballot underway...each state tramps up to front of room to cast their ballots.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Welcome...we are doing a little bit of tweeting from the RNC Chair election today in DC...Fix currently ensconced in room.
author: TheHyperFix

text: That's all folks. Thanks for joining us today and tune in next week for more live Twittering. SPREAD THE WORD on @thehyperfix
author: TheHyperFix

text: "President believes time he spent here and on Capitol Hill talking to members was time well spent" -- Gibbs on courtship on econstimpack.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "The input has been there. The legislation is reflective of that." -- Gibbs on econstimpack.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Kirk Victor of National Journal. Nobody better. Seriously.  Ask Kirk how he is doing. Answer is always "persevering".
author: TheHyperFix

text: Apparently I missed a Gibbs "prejudge" when he was talking about Obama and superbowl...thanks for the vigilance.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Ok, ignore my briefing stops at 3...it's now 3:02 pm.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "Swing at it a third time" -- Gibbs falls back on the baseball metaphor. Doing this briefing is like an unassisted triple play.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Dow update: Down 190. Gibbs today -- no harm, no foul.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @natthedem "Is the President coming into the press room for his statement at 3PM or are they delaying that?" No. Meeting with folks in oval
author: TheHyperFix

text: Koffler looks bored.  Or amused.  Or stewing quietly.
author: TheHyperFix

text: J-Mart goes jacketless and with the tie hung at a jaunty angle. Damn web guys....
author: TheHyperFix

text: Jonathan Martin of Politico! Love it.  J-Mart is a GREAT guy...knows bbq better than any other reporter.
author: TheHyperFix

text: BREAKING: Gibbs has not threatened anyone....today.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "it's hard for me to step inside the mindset of different people...". Was that a "Being John Malkovich" reference?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Question: How does Gibbs know what time it is? He was a watch on but he can't look at it without seeming bored.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Koffler goes jacketless in the press briefing. BOLD.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "Even while we disagree, we don't have to do is disagreeably" -- Gibbs, sticking to his guns on econstimpack.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs will almost certainly end this before 3 as Obama is set to meet with Geithner.
author: TheHyperFix

text: That was Keith Koffler. Great guy and WH press corps vet.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @Jamesbedell "your twitter avatar looks like that old SNL skit where the reporter has a camera duct-taped to his head." Awesome.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @amslotnik on updates: "Just right, at least for me. Daily briefing is while I'm at work, so I watch my Twitter client over my shoulder"
author: TheHyperFix

text: Les Kinsolving goes before the NYT!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Les Kinsolving! Worldnet Daily.  Les is a legend of the press room.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Ken Herman (of Cox) on Digital TV.  Good stuff.  Gibbs has no answer.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs, citing Obama, questions whether a dialogue with Iran would be with Ahmadinejad.  Did I spell that write?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Take note: Gibbs is being VERY careful on the Iran question.  He doesn't want to make news or cause int'l conflict with flippant remark.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Dow update: Down 188. Come on Gibbs. Turn it around.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs appears to be fading...heavy sniffling and throat clearing...and was that a cough?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Sound off...too many updates? too few?  TheHyperFix is a work in progress.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "When are you going to show us a little more leg?" -- WSJ's Weisman to Gibbs. (And yes, badly out of context.)
author: TheHyperFix

text: BUT, does say Obama has "affection" for Rooney family who owns the Steelers. Interesting, Rep. Tom Rooney (Fla.) is a Republican.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "I've not asked him specifically who he is rooting for." -- Gibbs punts on Superbowl question.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "The fine Washington Post" -- Gibbs confirms Obama reads our paper. Whew.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Shear is DOMINATING.  This is like a one on one interview with Gibbs.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @roadkillrefugee "WH Super Bowl Party Food Watch. If WH fails to serve chili Cincinnati-style, is Obama stiff-arming Boehner? Developing..."
author: TheHyperFix

text: Not going to write them but all of this "package" talk prompts lots of "That's what she said" moments. Homage to "The Office"
author: TheHyperFix

text: Shear gets the Superbowl question in. Well played sir!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Mike Shear. Wash Post!  Go Shear Go.  Interesting Shear fact: computer genius and MAC lover.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "President is not going to referee what individual interest groups on either side of this do" -- Gibbs on outside ads on econstimpack
author: TheHyperFix

text: @Enriquetat "Dude, he going to see your stream and you never going to get the invite to President Obamas Superbowl party Fix!" Ugh.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Governator mention: "It is not a tumah!"... "Get to the choppa"...we could go on all day.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Tapper is getting his face in the shot here as Major Garrett asks his question....double exposure!
author: TheHyperFix

text: @redcrossmom "Somebody needs to stroke count how often Gibbs says ahh..uh..um" A common complaint but hard to speak off cuff for an hour...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Dow update: Down 174...the Gibbs effect continues...Fix needs to call his stockbroker.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Again we ask, WHERE IS MILBANK?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs is like Michael Jordan in the 1997 NBA finals: http://espn.go.com/classic/s/jordanmichaeladd.html
author: TheHyperFix

text: remember how Bill Clinton watched the Superbowl last year with New Mex Gov. Bill Richardson. Awesome.
author: TheHyperFix

text: BREAKING: Obama will have Members of Congress over to WH to watch Superbowl....
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs didn't go to cocktail party last night. Read book on mummies to his son, Ethan. Name dropper!
author: TheHyperFix

text: It's a run on WH correspondents with facial hair. Mark Knoller (of CBS) rocking the full beard.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "we took a very important step forward last night" -- Gibbs on econstimpack vote.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Chuck flaunting his goatee...
author: TheHyperFix

text: Chuck looks as though he has gotten a haircut -- tightening up the sides. We likey.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Chuck Todd, media god.  Behind Chuck Todd's goatee is another fist.
author: TheHyperFix

text: 15 minutes in...Gibbs has yet to say "prejudge". COME ON!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs is sticking to the post-partisan message...despite the 0 GOP votes for econstimpack.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Folks asking why AP gets first question...tradition as dominant wire service.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @obamafoodorama "Loving you, buddy. Just wanted to say." Thanks. And great username
author: TheHyperFix

text: Obama's time consulting with Repubs is "important" due to the state of the economy, sez Gibbs.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "Old habits die hard" -- Gibbs, apparently unaware of newspaper readership numbers.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Obama has no regrets about the way he handled the GOP outreach; "President wouldn't do anything differently"
author: TheHyperFix

text: Finally a stim pack question.....
author: TheHyperFix

text: "The president shares the American peoples' outrage on this." -- Gibbs on exec pay
author: TheHyperFix

text: Dow update: Down 189...bless MSNBC for including it on the screen with Gibbs.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "Mere Senator Obama". -- Gibbs gets the joke.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "When the president was a mere Senator...." Tapper, flashing that wry sense of humor.
author: TheHyperFix

text: CEO pay may be the new econ stimulus.  Tapper (of ABC) makes it a third question on the topic.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Helen Thomas jumps the line...for a follow up on exec pay. "What can he do"? says Helen
author: TheHyperFix

text: Interesting: First two questions NOT about econ stim bill.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Obama apparently eager to condemn CEOs payouts. Will make remarks at 3. That means this briefing ends before then.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs on Gitmo ruling today: Doesn't affect the ability to assess situation of those held there
author: TheHyperFix

text: So you know...these briefings are PACKED...people standing in the aisles...won't always be like that but Obama/Gibbs is the hot show now
author: TheHyperFix

text: As a matter of tradition, Jennifer Loven (of AP) ALWAYS gets first question.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs breaks the streak...a blue shirt today.
author: TheHyperFix

text: BREAKING: Gibbs has cold!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Dow update: Down 200 as Gibbs starts.
author: TheHyperFix

text: And away we go. Gibbs comes armed with water.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Learning my lesson, I ate BEFORE this briefing. (ham/swiss on a sesame bagel). Take that gawker!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Quick update: Press briefing has been moved to 2:15 pm. But, we are STILL live twittering in this space!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Ok, this isn't on topic...but if you are near a TV...go watch Blago defending himself in front of the state Senate. Must watch!
author: TheHyperFix

text: We have crested 1,000 people following the live twitter!  Yes! Thanks to all! Spread the word!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Stay tuned: At 1:45 pm (or so) today, we'll be live twittering the White House press briefing in this space.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Tomorrow (Thursday) we are live-blogging the Gibbs daily briefing...so stay tuned. Also, let's get over 1,000 followers before then!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Ok, it's finally done.  Thanks for joining and make sure to check our future daily press briefings tweets. Check this space for updates.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs just keeps going. Geithner made an "honest mistake"; dodges the reference to Wesley Snipes in the question. Smart.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "There is only email system at a time..." -- Gibbs pokes fun at the failures of the email system.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Thanks for taking part in our first ever Twitter from the WH press briefing room. More to come! Tell your friends!
author: TheHyperFix

text: @Enriquetat "it was good- nice shirt and glasses work for you"
author: TheHyperFix

text: @davemitrani "you were good, but where is chuck todd?!" I always stand in Chuck's shadow. He is to my left, asked 2nd question of briefing.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Mark Knoller (of CBS radio) has THE greatest voice.  Deep, resonating. Awesome.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Rate my question: Good, bad or indifferent? Just trying to shake it up with a little Al Gore...
author: TheHyperFix

text: This is one of the brightest differences between Obama and Bush -- environment...Obama aides openly critical of Bush policy.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Fix question! GORE-acle!
author: TheHyperFix

text: "Stimulative" sounds dirty...it isn't, but it sounds that way.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Gibbs...heading into the 40th minute...Fix dreaming of a trip to "Breadline" shortly.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "Tinker under the hood" ! Yes! Gibbs is letting his southern side out today.  Love it.  Now we are waiting for "That dog won't hunt"
author: TheHyperFix

text: Lots of note-taking from Psaki, Burton, Cherlin, Shapiro....Maybe Gibbs likes a daily review of his performance ;)
author: TheHyperFix

text: It's official. Word of the day is "process". Beats out "prejudge" by a hair.
author: TheHyperFix

text: @buffalodavid "Wish I could twitter you a ruben" Um, me too. Mouth just started watering.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Helen Thomas goes with the Afghanistan question. Direct!
author: TheHyperFix

text: Lots of "processes" being started....eventually all of these processes have to lead to a solution...or Obama popularity will plummet
author: TheHyperFix

text: Fix follower update...we are now over 500 following @thehyperfix...thanks to all...spread the word.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "We fired most of the bullets in that gun." -- Gibbs on "monetary policy". Now that's the folksiness we expect out of an Auburn man.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Briefing is right now at 30 minutes or so...Gibbs first briefing was nearly an hour...second about half that.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Love it! "Kabuki theater". I pledge to use that phrase at least once a week in The Fix from here on out. Unless the editors tell me I can't.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Hans goes with "prejudge". Is that the word of the early days of the Obama Administration?
author: TheHyperFix

text: Hans Nichols of Bloomberg. Plays hoops with Fix...GREAT athlete. Tennis player at Cornell (alma mater of Andy Bernards of "The Office")
author: TheHyperFix

text: Obama also "anxious" to get bipartisan support. Fix anxious to get food.
author: TheHyperFix

text: Obama "open minded" and "energetic" about getting bipartisan support. Fix is open minded and energetic about eating after this.
author: TheHyperFix

text: "This wasn't cowboy diplomacy" -- Gibbs on Obama's "I won".
